events.name: Android and iOS Development: In war and in harmony

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
Google Developers Group Cyprus in collaboration with HackCyprus and the support of KIOS Research and Innovation Centre of Excellence are hosting a tech talk about “Android and iOS Development: In war and in harmony”, by Silouanos Nicolaou.

In this presentation, Silouanos will try to compare the two main mobile platforms; iOS and Android, and how they are used to build the user interface (UI). The presentation will focus on the differences in building the UI and the learning curve for each platform. Silouanos will then demonstrate good and bad practices often followed in each platform.

In the second part of this presentation, Silouanos will talk about how a programmer can utilise the new Android's programming language, Kotlin, to build shared code for the two platforms.

18:00 Doors Open
18:30 Talk starts
19:30 Meet & Greet

p.s. Beers and Pizzas will be provided
_______________________________________________________________________________________

Το Google Developers Group Cyprus, σε συνεργασία με το HackCyprus και την υποστήριξη του Κέντρου Αριστείας για Έρευνα και Καινοτομία «ΚΟΙΟΣ» του Πανεπιστημίου Κύπρου, διοργανώνει ομιλία με θέμα “Android and iOS Development: In war and in harmony”, με τον Σιλουανό Νικολάου.

Σε αυτή τη παρουσίαση, o Σιλουανός θα επικεντρωθεί στις δυο μεγάλες πλατφόρμες ανάπτυξης εφαρμογών για κινητά: iOS και Android, και πως χρησιμοποιούνται για την υλοποίηση της διεπαφής χρήστη (UI). Η παρουσίαση θα επικεντρωθεί στις διαφορές μεταξύ της iOS και Android πλατφόρμας, και στις δυσκολίες και τις ευκολίες της κάθε μιας. Στη συνέχεια, ο Σιλουανός θα κάνει επίδειξη της υλοποίησης της διεπαφής στις δύο πλατφόρμες ζωντανά στο κοινό και θα συζητήσει τα αρνητικά και τα θετικά της κάθε πλατφόρμας.

Στο δεύτερο μέρος της παρουσίασης, ο Σιλουανός θα παρουσιάσει τα ωφελήματα που μπορεί να έχει ένας προγραμματιστής χρησιμοποιώντας την Kotlin, την νέα γλώσσα του Android, τα οποία θα τον οδηγήσουν στην υλοποίηση κώδικα που θα είναι σε θέση να χρησιμοποιηθεί και από τις δύο πλατφόρμες.

18:00 Ανοίγουν οι πόρτες
18:30 Ομιλία
19:30 Δικτύωση

Υ.Γ Θα παρέχονται μπύρες και πιτσα.
events.how_to_find_us: Panepistimioupoli, Building 7, Room 010 (This is the same building as Nero caffe, in ground floor)

events.name: GDG Cyprus Christmas Drinkabout
events.description:
The new year is just around the corner and we are feeling festive!

After our first android meetup last week, we'd like to run something more casual, something to celebrate the start of GDG Cyprus, the end of 2018 and the start of 2019! We'd love to meet you and have a drink together!

Come, join us this Sunday at Moondogs bar, Nicosia, for a chat and a drink. We'd love to pay for your drinks, but we are a newborn GDG with no sponsorship; so bring your wallet for your own consumption.

events.name: GDG Cyprus New Year's Drinkabout
events.description:
2019 is here!

We are running a Christmas drinkabout in Nicosia, so we've decided to run a New Year's drinkabout in Limassol!

Come, join us on Saturday - location in Limassol to be decided - for a chat and a drink. We'd love to pay for your drinks, but we are a newborn GDG with no sponsorship; so bring your wallet for your own consumption.

events.name: Workshop: Designing for wicked problems

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
The Google Developers Group Cyprus presents the workshop:

”Designing for wicked problems“
by Panayotis Tzinis.

📝Evening schedule 📝

18:30 Open for arrival
18:50 Welcome to GDG Cyprus meetup
19:00 Workshop
20:30 Social, food and drinks

Panayotis (AKA Darth), is the Intelligence Tech Lead of the X | Lab and a Google Developer Expert on Product Design, focusing on AI and Human Interface behavior and is a Google Developer Expert Sprint Master.
Throughout this workshop we will intro "wicked problems", what they are, how to address them and how to "try" to solve them without creating others! That's wicked!
At the Lab Exercise attendees will do some hands-on design/sketching, discussion and ideation.
It is a process inspired by Google UX leads in order for everybody to start design thinking and try to overcome barriers of their comfy zone.
It is addressed to everybody, there is no need for bringing a laptop with you, although you should bring a notepad and a pen!
After the workshop there will be time for networking and sharing of ideas!
Google will sponsor our Pizzas and Drinks!

For directions in finding the exact building and room, feel free to use this website: https://goo.gl/E4ENfi
events.how_to_find_us:
University of Cyprus - Nicosia
OED 01 Building 1st Floor, Room 130

events.name: HashCode Competition

venue.name: University of Cyprus, Computer Science & Maths Building

events.description:
Location: University Of Cyprus

Computer Society Cyprus is hosting Hashcode competition like every year.

Google’s team-based programming competition, Hash Code, allows you to share your skills and connect with other coders as you work together to solve a problem modeled off a real Google engineering challenge! In small teams of two to four, coders all over the world will tackle the first problem through an Online Qualification Round. Though this round is hosted online, teams can come together to compete side-by-side in locally coordinated Hash Code hubs. The top teams from this round are invited to join us at an international Google office for our annual Hash Code Final Round.
